alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 08 at 11:49PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...High Water Levels Possible This Week... A warming trend to near or just above normal temperatures is expected across Interior and Northern Alaska. Highs in the low to mid 60s by Wednesday and continued warm into the weekend. These warming temperatures, combined with a much above normal snowpack over most of the Interior, will cause a significant increase in snowmelt. Runoff into rivers south of the Brooks Range later this week and next week will cause water levels to rise and breakup to begin on many rivers. The increased runoff may also cause smaller streams and creeks to rise to bankfull levels later this week. The chances of breakup and/or snow melt flooding are above normal this spring over eastern Alaska, with river breakup running a week or more later than normal. People along Interior rivers and streams should prepare for the possibility of high water levels this week and next week due to ice breakup and snowmelt runoff. The latest breakup information is available at www.weather.gov/aprfc/breakupMap.
